channel.title: How to change a password for an account that you dont know the password to on XP
channel.description:
Okay this is how you do this on windows XP
Now this may sound stupid, but it may help for those people who get constantly grounded like me =P First you need access to an administrator account so this is the hard part, you just have to wait for your parents to leave the computer on or something so you can get on for about 1 minute. (one way i reccomend is tell them you need to research for homework or something and actually research but do this at the same time)
If you somehow get access to the computer administrator account, Go to start>run. This should bring up a little window where you need to type in "cmd" (with no quotations).. It will bring up the command box where you will type this: [code]net user[/code]
It will bring up a list of all of the accounts on your PC. after you type that, type this: [code]net user (name of user you want to change the password to)*[/code] So if the persons name was bill you would put: [code] net user bill *[/code] Make sure you put a space in between the persons name and the *
Okay now if you cant get onto an administrator account, theres another way to do this (this way is reccomended even if you can get on an admin account, but all credits go to jonckr)
Boot up in safe mode. Then you want to log in as the account "Administrator" Do the same steps as earlier, or use the admin account to delete the password, or change the password.
Hope this helps you desperate little folks out there :P

item.title: How to change a password for an account that you dont know the password to on XP
item.dc:creator: @gho5t gho5t
item.description:
@gho5t wrote:

wertyuiop, I meant if you temporarily have access to an admin account. Also if you want to change them in control panel, you have to know the original password.

You should completely read the tutorial thoroughly before judging it.

Read full topic

item.title: How to change a password for an account that you dont know the password to on XP
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

gho5t, add what joncr said.

Because if you’re not an Administrator account in XP, you’ll receive an ACCESS-DENIED error message.

Read full topic

item.title: How to change a password for an account that you dont know the password to on XP
item.dc:creator: @jonckr jonckr
item.description:
@jonckr wrote:

Actually there is a much better way.

  1. start up your computer in safe mode
  2. login your computer in the account called " Administrator" (not many people know this, that they have another admin account in safe-mode)
  3. use the admin account to delete the password or change the password without even knowing the existing one =D

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

Saminside is better, takes about 10 minutes to crack a password. If you change it, and forget or don’t have time to change it back, then you could get caught.

Read full topic
